**Promises:** What promises were made? (E.g. pledges to build houses, lower taxes

or to waive education fees.

**Any concerns or issues raised by the audience?**

**Were there any hecklers or interruptions or interjections by people at the**

**rally or meeting?** Listen carefully - what they say will add colour to your story?

**Did anything unexpected, quirky or unusual happen?**

**Did any of the speakers make contradictory statements or shifts from their**

**party’s policies?**

**What was the mood of the rally/meeting?** (Tense, light-hearted, trouble makers

in the crowd etc)

**How big was the crowd?** (Even if figures differ, ensure you quote a variety of

sources: your estimates, the police, the organisers, stadium management etc)

**Tip:** Count the number of people in a section of the crowd. Then estimate how

many similar sized sections there are and multiply these by the number of people in

the section you counted to get a rough estimate)

**What security is present?** Are police, army, private security present? Are they

armed?

**Any opposition supporters present?** Were they armed, even with stones, and

how did they behave?

**Was there any commotions or violence?** (You may have missed something so

don’t jump to conclusions if something happens. Interview as many people as

possible)

**Did any speakers attack political opponents?** Get a response from those who

were attacked)

**ADDITIONAL NOTES:**

**CONTACT DETAILS OF ORGANISERS AND PEOPLE YOU**

**INTERVIEWED**

_**Adapted from the International Federation of Journalists ELECTION**_

_**REPORTING HANDBOOK**_
